intro: Lippia crucifera, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open areas and is often found in disturbed soils. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices. Lippia crucifera is also used in some regions for its essential oils and as a spice.
